Path: README.md
 1	# GeekDiary Android App
 2	
 3	A modern Android diary application built with Jetpack Compose, following Material Design 3 guidelines.
 4	
 5	## Features
 6	
 7	- **Main Page**: View today's diary entry with date navigation
 8	- **Offline-First**: Local storage with background synchronization
 9	- **Modern UI**: Built with Jetpack Compose and Material Design 3
 10	- **Secure Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with secure token storage
 11	
 12	## Tech Stack
 13	
 14	- **UI**: Jetpack Compose, Material Design 3
 15	- **Architecture**: MVVM with Repository pattern
 16	- **Dependency Injection**: Hilt
 17	- **Database**: Room (SQLite)
 18	- **Networking**: Retrofit + OkHttp
 19	- **JSON**: Moshi
 20	- **Testing**: JUnit, Mockito, Turbine
 21	
 22	## Project Structure
 23	
 24	```
 25	app/src/main/java/com/example/geekdiary/
 26	├── data/
 27	│ ├── local/ # Room database, DAOs, entities
 28	│ ├── remote/ # API services, DTOs
 29	│ └── repository/ # Repository implementations
 30	├── domain/
 31	│ ├── model/ # Domain models
 32	│ ├── repository/ # Repository interfaces
 33	│ └── usecase/ # Business logic use cases
 34	├── presentation/
 35	│ ├── ui/
 36	│ │ ├── main/ # Main screen
 37	│ │ ├── auth/ # Authentication screens
 38	│ │ └── theme/ # App theme
 39	│ └── viewmodel/ # ViewModels
 40	└── di/ # Hilt modules
 41	```
 42	
 43	## Backend API
 44	
 45	The app connects to a local backend running at `http://localhost:8080` with the following endpoints:
 46	
 47	- `POST /v1/authorize` - Authentication
 48	- `GET /v1/user` - User profile
 49	- `GET /v1/items` - Get diary entries
 50	- `PUT /v1/items` - Create/update diary entries
 51	- `GET /v1/sync/changes` - Synchronization
 52	
 53	## Development Setup
 54	
 55	1. Clone the repository
 56	2. Open in Android Studio
 57	3. Ensure backend is running at `http://localhost:8080`
 58	4. Build and run the app
 59	
 60	## Testing
 61	
 62	Run tests with:
 63	```bash
 64	./gradlew test
 65	./gradlew connectedAndroidTest
 66	```
 67	
 68	## Code Style
 69	
 70	- Follow standard Kotlin conventions
 71	- Use meaningful variable and function names
 72	- Add KDoc comments for public APIs
 73	- Keep functions small and focused
 74	- Use dependency injection for testability

 179	}

 1	package com.example.geekdiary
 2	
 3	import android.content.pm.PackageManager
 4	import android.os.Bundle
 5	import android.widget.Toast
 6	import androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
 7	import androidx.activity.compose.setContent
 8	import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
 9	import androidx.activity.result.contract.ActivityResultContracts
 10	import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxSize
 11	import androidx.compose.material3.MaterialTheme
 12	import androidx.compose.material3.Surface
 13	import androidx.compose.runtime.Composable
 14	import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
 15	import androidx.compose.ui.tooling.preview.Preview
 16	import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint
 17	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.PermissionManager
 18	import com.example.geekdiary.navigation.DiaryNavigation
 19	import com.example.geekdiary.ui.theme.GeekDiaryTheme
 20	import javax.inject.Inject
 21	
 22	@AndroidEntryPoint
 23	class MainActivity : ComponentActivity() {
 24	
 25	 @Inject
 26	 lateinit var permissionManager: PermissionManager
 27	
 28	 private val storagePermissionLauncher = registerForActivityResult(
 29	 ActivityResultContracts.RequestMultiplePermissions()
 30	 ) { permissions ->
 31	 val allGranted = permissions.values.all { it }
 32	 if (allGranted) {
 33	 Toast.makeText(this, "Storage permissions granted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
 34	 } else {
 35	 Toast.makeText(
 36	 this,
 37	 "Storage permissions are required for asset management",
 38	 Toast.LENGTH_LONG
 39	 ).show()
 40	 }
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 44	 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 45	 enableEdgeToEdge()
 46	
 47	 // Request storage permissions if needed
 48	 requestStoragePermissionsIfNeeded()
 49	
 50	 setContent {
 51	 GeekDiaryTheme {
 52	 Surface(
 53	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize(),
 54	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.background
 55	 ) {
 56	 DiaryApp()
 57	 }
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 private fun requestStoragePermissionsIfNeeded() {
 63	 if (!permissionManager.hasStoragePermissions()) {
 64	 val requiredPermissions = permissionManager.getRequiredStoragePermissions()
 65	 if (requiredPermissions.isNotEmpty()) {
 66	 if (permissionManager.shouldShowStoragePermissionRationale(this)) {
 67	 // Show rationale dialog
 68	 Toast.makeText(
 69	 this,
 70	 "Storage permissions are needed to save and manage diary assets (images and videos)",
 71	 Toast.LENGTH_LONG
 72	 ).show()
 73	 }
 74	 storagePermissionLauncher.launch(requiredPermissions)
 75	 }
 76	 }
 77	 }
 78	}
 79	
 80	@Composable
 81	fun DiaryApp() {
 82	 DiaryNavigation()
 83	}
 84	
 85	@Preview(showBackground = true)
 86	@Composable
 87	fun DiaryAppPreview() {
 88	 GeekDiaryTheme {
 89	 DiaryApp()
 90	 }
 91	}...

 5	/**
 6	 * Utility class for parsing Markdown content to extract asset references
 7	 * and transform URLs between backend and local formats.
 8	 */
 9	class MarkdownAssetParser {
 10	 
 11	 companion object {
 12	 // Regex pattern to match ![](filename.ext) format
 13	 private val ASSET_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("!\\[([^\\]]*)\\]\\(([^)]+)\\)")
 14	 
 15	 // Common image and video file extensions
 16	 private val SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS = setOf(
 17	 "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "gif", "webp", "bmp", "svg",
 18	 "mp4", "avi", "mov", "wmv", "flv", "webm", "mkv"
 19	 )
 20	 
 21	 private const val BACKEND_ASSET_PATH = "/web/assets/"
 22	 }
 23	 
 24	 /**
 25	 * Extract asset filenames from Markdown content
 26	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content to parse
 27	 * @return List of asset filenames found in the content
 28	 */
 29	 fun extractAssetFilenames(markdownContent: String): List<String> {
 30	 val assetFilenames = mutableListOf<String>()
 31	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 32	 
 33	 while (matcher.find()) {
 34	 val url = matcher.group(2) // The URL part inside parentheses
 35	 val filename = extractFilenameFromUrl(url)
 36	 
 37	 if (filename != null && isSupportedAssetFile(filename)) {
 38	 assetFilenames.add(filename)
 39	 }
 40	 }
 41	 
 42	 return assetFilenames.distinct()
 43	 }

 56	 ): String {

 58	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
...

 76	 /**
 77	 * Convert local file paths to backend URLs in Markdown content
 78	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with local file paths
 79	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 80	 * @return Markdown content with backend URLs
 81	 */
 82	 fun convertLocalUrlsToBackend(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 83	 var result = markdownContent
 84	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 85	 
 86	 while (matcher.find()) {
 87	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 88	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 89	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 90	 
 91	 if (url.startsWith("file://")) {
 92	 // Extract filename from local file path
 93	 val localPath = url.removePrefix("file://")
 94	 val filename = localPath.substringAfterLast("/")
 95	 
 96	 if (isSupportedAssetFile(filename)) {
 97	 val backendUrl = "$baseUrl$BACKEND_ASSET_PATH$filename"
 98	 val newMatch = "![$altText]($backendUrl)"
 99	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 100	 }
 101	 }
 102	 }
 103	 
 104	 return result
 105	 }
 106	 
 107	 /**
 108	 * Convert relative asset filenames to full backend URLs
 109	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with relative filenames
 110	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 111	 * @return Markdown content with full backend URLs
 112	 */
 113	 fun convertRelativeToBackendUrls(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 114	 var result = markdownContent
 115	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 116	 
 117	 while (matcher.find()) {
 118	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 119	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 120	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 121	 
 122	 // Check if it's a relative filename (no protocol, no path separators except filename)
 123	 if (!url.contains("://") && !url.startsWith("/") && isSupportedAssetFile(url)) {
 124	 val backendUrl = "$baseUrl$BACKEND_ASSET_PATH$url"
 125	 val newMatch = "![$altText]($backendUrl)"
 126	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 127	 }
 128	 }
 129	 
 130	 return result
 131	 }

 164	 /**
 165	 * Check if a filename has a supported asset file extension
 166	 * @param filename The filename to check
 167	 * @return True if the file extension is supported
 168	 */
 169	 private fun isSupportedAssetFile(filename: String): Boolean {
 170	 val extension = filename.substringAfterLast(".", "").lowercase()
 171	 return extension.isNotEmpty() && SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS.contains(extension)
 172	 }

 178	 */
 179	 fun hasAssetReferences(markdownContent: String): Boolean {
 180	 return extractAssetFilenames(markdownContent).isNotEmpty()
 181	 }

 7	/**
 8	 * Utility class for transforming Markdown content between backend and local asset URLs
 9	 */
 10	@Singleton
 11	class MarkdownLinkTransformer @Inject constructor(
 12	 private val markdownAssetParser: MarkdownAssetParser,
 13	 private val assetRepository: AssetRepository
 14	) {
 15	 
 16	 /**
 17	 * Transform Markdown content from backend format to local format for display
 18	 * Converts backend asset URLs to local file paths where available
 19	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with backend URLs
 20	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 21	 * @return Markdown content with local file paths where available
 22	 */
 23	 suspend fun transformForDisplay(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 24	 try {
 25	 // Extract asset filenames from the content
 26	 val assetFilenames = markdownAssetParser.extractAssetFilenames(markdownContent)
 27	 
 28	 // Build mapping of filename to local path for available assets
 29	 val assetPathMapping = mutableMapOf<String, String>()
 30	 
 31	 for (filename in assetFilenames) {
 32	 val localPath = assetRepository.getLocalFilePath(filename)
 33	 if (localPath != null) {
 34	 assetPathMapping[filename] = localPath
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 // Convert backend URLs to local paths where available
 39	 return markdownAssetParser.convertBackendUrlsToLocal(
 40	 markdownContent, 
 41	 baseUrl, 
 42	 assetPathMapping
 43	 )
 44	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 45	 println("Error transforming markdown for display: ${e.message}")
 46	 return markdownContent
 47	 }
 48	 }
 49

 54	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 55	 * @return Markdown content with backend URLs
 56	 */
 57	 suspend fun transformForSync(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 58	 try {
 59	 return markdownAssetParser.convertLocalUrlsToBackend(markdownContent, baseUrl)
 60	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 61	 println("Error transforming markdown for sync: ${e.message}")
 62	 return markdownContent
 63	 }
 64	 }

 267	 }
 268	 }

 1	package com.example.geekdiary.data.util
 2	
 3	import java.util.regex.Pattern
 4	
 5	/**
 6	 * Utility class for parsing Markdown content to extract asset references
 7	 * and transform URLs between backend and local formats.
 8	 */
 9	class MarkdownAssetParser {
 10	 
 11	 companion object {
 12	 // Regex pattern to match ![](filename.ext) format
 13	 private val ASSET_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("!\\[([^\\]]*)\\]\\(([^)]+)\\)")
 14	 
 15	 // Common image and video file extensions
 16	 private val SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS = setOf(
 17	 "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "gif", "webp", "bmp", "svg",
 18	 "mp4", "avi", "mov", "wmv", "flv", "webm", "mkv"
 19	 )
 20	 
 21	 private const val BACKEND_ASSET_PATH = "/web/assets/"
 22	 }
 23	 
 24	 /**
 25	 * Extract asset filenames from Markdown content
 26	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content to parse
 27	 * @return List of asset filenames found in the content
 28	 */
 29	 fun extractAssetFilenames(markdownContent: String): List<String> {
 30	 val assetFilenames = mutableListOf<String>()
 31	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 32	 
 33	 while (matcher.find()) {
 34	 val url = matcher.group(2) // The URL part inside parentheses
 35	 val filename = extractFilenameFromUrl(url)
 36	 
 37	 if (filename != null && isSupportedAssetFile(filename)) {
 38	 assetFilenames.add(filename)
 39	 }
 40	 }
 41	 
 42	 return assetFilenames.distinct()
 43	 }
 44	 
 45	 /**
 46	 * Convert backend asset URLs to local file paths in Markdown content
 47	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with backend URLs
 48	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 49	 * @param assetPathMapping Map of filename to local file path
 50	 * @return Markdown content with local file paths
 51	 */
 52	 fun convertBackendUrlsToLocal(
 53	 markdownContent: String, 
 54	 baseUrl: String,
 55	 assetPathMapping: Map<String, String>
 56	 ): String {
 57	 var result = markdownContent
 58	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 59	 
 60	 while (matcher.find()) {
 61	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 62	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 63	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 64	 
 65	 val filename = extractFilenameFromUrl(url)
 66	 if (filename != null && assetPathMapping.containsKey(filename)) {
 67	 val localPath = assetPathMapping[filename]
 68	 val newMatch = "![$altText](file://$localPath)"
 69	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 70	 }
 71	 }
 72	 
 73	 return result
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 /**
 77	 * Convert local file paths to backend URLs in Markdown content
 78	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with local file paths
 79	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 80	 * @return Markdown content with backend URLs
 81	 */
 82	 fun convertLocalUrlsToBackend(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 83	 var result = markdownContent
 84	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 85	 
 86	 while (matcher.find()) {
 87	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 88	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 89	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 90	 
 91	 if (url.startsWith("file://")) {
 92	 // Extract filename from local file path
 93	 val localPath = url.removePrefix("file://")
 94	 val filename = localPath.substringAfterLast("/")
 95	 
 96	 if (isSupportedAssetFile(filename)) {
 97	 val backendUrl = "$baseUrl$BACKEND_ASSET_PATH$filename"
 98	 val newMatch = "![$altText]($backendUrl)"
 99	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 100	 }
 101	 }
 102	 }
 103	 
 104	 return result
 105	 }
 106	 
 107	 /**
 108	 * Convert relative asset filenames to full backend URLs
 109	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with relative filenames
 110	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 111	 * @return Markdown content with full backend URLs
 112	 */
 113	 fun convertRelativeToBackendUrls(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 114	 var result = markdownContent
 115	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 116	 
 117	 while (matcher.find()) {
 118	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 119	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 120	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 121	 
 122	 // Check if it's a relative filename (no protocol, no path separators except filename)
 123	 if (!url.contains("://") && !url.startsWith("/") && isSupportedAssetFile(url)) {
 124	 val backendUrl = "$baseUrl$BACKEND_ASSET_PATH$url"
 125	 val newMatch = "![$altText]($backendUrl)"
 126	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 127	 }
 128	 }
 129	 
 130	 return result
 131	 }
 132	 
 133	 /**
 134	 * Extract filename from a URL or file path
 135	 * @param url The URL or file path
 136	 * @return The filename or null if not found
 137	 */
 138	 private fun extractFilenameFromUrl(url: String): String? {
 139	 return try {
 140	 // Handle different URL formats
 141	 when {
 142	 url.contains(BACKEND_ASSET_PATH) -> {
 143	 // Backend URL: extract filename after /web/assets/
 144	 url.substringAfter(BACKEND_ASSET_PATH).substringBefore("?")
 145	 }
 146	 url.startsWith("file://") -> {
 147	 // Local file path: extract filename
 148	 url.removePrefix("file://").substringAfterLast("/")
 149	 }
 150	 url.contains("/") -> {
 151	 // Other URL with path: extract last segment
 152	 url.substringAfterLast("/").substringBefore("?")
 153	 }
 154	 else -> {
 155	 // Assume it's just a filename
 156	 url.substringBefore("?")
 157	 }
 158	 }
 159	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 160	 null
 161	 }
 162	 }
 163	 
 164	 /**
 165	 * Check if a filename has a supported asset file extension
 166	 * @param filename The filename to check
 167	 * @return True if the file extension is supported
 168	 */
 169	 private fun isSupportedAssetFile(filename: String): Boolean {
 170	 val extension = filename.substringAfterLast(".", "").lowercase()
 171	 return extension.isNotEmpty() && SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS.contains(extension)
 172	 }
 173	 
 174	 /**
 175	 * Check if Markdown content contains any asset references
 176	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content to check
 177	 * @return True if content contains asset references
 178	 */
 179	 fun hasAssetReferences(markdownContent: String): Boolean {
 180	 return extractAssetFilenames(markdownContent).isNotEmpty()
 181	 }
 182	}
 183

Your Android app build was failing due to a Hilt/Dagger missing binding. Specifically, Hilt could not provide an instance of MarkdownAssetParser, which is required in several places (AssetSyncManager, AssetReferenceTracker, MarkdownLinkTransformer, and transitively MainViewModel via SyncManager).

## What I did
- Reproduced the failure with Gradle and captured the error.
- Added proper Hilt support to MarkdownAssetParser by:
 - Adding an @Inject constructor
 - Marking it @Singleton
- Rebuilt the app to verify. The build now succeeds.

## Key change
I converted MarkdownAssetParser into an injectable singleton:

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/example/geekdiary/data/util/MarkdownAssetParser.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
import javax.inject.Inject
import javax.inject.Singleton

@Singleton
class MarkdownAssetParser @Inject constructor() {
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Everything else in the file remains the same.

## Build result
- Command: ./gradlew :app:assembleDebug --stacktrace --no-daemon
- Result: BUILD SUCCESSFUL
- Notes: You will see some warnings related to Kapt and Moshi suggesting a future migration to KSP; these are non-blocking.

## Next steps
- If you want, I can migrate Moshi codegen from Kapt to KSP to remove the deprecation warnings.
- Would you like me to run unit tests now? If so, I can execute ./gradlew test and address any failures.

 1	package com.example.geekdiary.presentation.auth
 2	
 3	import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
 4	import androidx.lifecycle.viewModelScope
 5	import com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkResult
 6	import com.example.geekdiary.domain.model.AuthData
 7	import com.example.geekdiary.domain.repository.AuthRepository
 8	import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.StateFlow
 11	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow
 12	import kotlinx.coroutines.launch
 13	import javax.inject.Inject
 14	
 15	data class LoginUiState(
 16	 val isLoading: Boolean = false,
 17	 val isLoginSuccessful: Boolean = false,
 18	 val emailError: String? = null,
 19	 val passwordError: String? = null,
 20	 val errorMessage: String? = null
 21	)
 22	
 23	@HiltViewModel
 24	class LoginViewModel @Inject constructor(
 25	 private val authRepository: AuthRepository
 26	) : ViewModel() {
 27	 
 28	 private val _uiState = MutableStateFlow(LoginUiState())
 29	 val uiState: StateFlow<LoginUiState> = _uiState.asStateFlow()
 30	 
 31	 fun login(email: String, password: String) {
 32	 // Clear previous errors
 33	 _uiState.value = _uiState.value.copy(
 34	 emailError = null,
 35	 passwordError = null,
 36	 errorMessage = null
 37	 )
 38	 
 39	 // Validate input
 40	 val emailError = validateEmail(email)
 41	 val passwordError = validatePassword(password)
 42	 
 43	 if (emailError != null || passwordError != null) {
 44	 _uiState.value = _uiState.value.copy(
 45	 emailError = emailError,
 46	 passwordError = passwordError
 47	 )
 48	 return
 49	 }
 50	 
 51	 // Perform login
 52	 _uiState.value = _uiState.value.copy(isLoading = true)
 53	 
 54	 viewModelScope.launch {
 55	 val authData = AuthData(email.trim(), password)
 56	 when (val result = authRepository.login(authData)) {
 57	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 58	 _uiState.value = _uiState.value.copy(
 59	 isLoading = false,
 60	 isLoginSuccessful = true
 61	 )
 62	 }
 63	 is NetworkResult.Error -> {
 64	 _uiState.value = _uiState.value.copy(
 65	 isLoading = false,
 66	 errorMessage = result.exception.message
 67	 )
 68	 }
 69	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> {
 70	 _uiState.value = _uiState.value.copy(isLoading = true)
 71	 }
 72	 }
 73	 }
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 private fun validateEmail(email: String): String? {
 77	 return when {
 78	 email.isBlank() -> "Email/Username is required"
 79	 email.length < 2 -> "Email/Username must be at least 2 characters"
 80	 else -> null
 81	 }
 82	 }
 83	 
 84	 private fun validatePassword(password: String): String? {
 85	 return when {
 86	 password.isBlank() -> "Password is required"
 87	 password.length < 3 -> "Password must be at least 3 characters"
 88	 else -> null
 89	 }
 90	 }
 91	}
 92

 24	@Singleton
 25	class AssetRepositoryImpl @Inject constructor(
 26	 private val assetApiService: AssetApiService,

 30	) : AssetRepository {
 31	 
 32	 override fun getAssetsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId: String): Flow<List<Asset>> {
 33	 return assetDao.getAssetsByDiaryEntryIdFlow(diaryEntryId).map { entities ->
 34	 entities.map { it.toDomain() }
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 override suspend fun getAssetByFilename(filename: String): Asset? {
 39	 return assetDao.getAssetByFilename(filename)?.toDomain()
 40	 }
 41	 
 42	 override suspend fun downloadAsset(filename: String, diaryEntryId: String): NetworkResult<Asset> {
 43	 try {
 44	 // Check if asset already exists locally
 45	 val existingAsset = assetDao.getAssetByFilename(filename)
 46	 if (existingAsset != null && existingAsset.isDownloaded) {
 47	 return NetworkResult.Success(existingAsset.toDomain())
 48	 }
 49	 
 50	 // Create or update asset entity
 51	 val assetId = existingAsset?.id ?: UUID.randomUUID().toString()
 52	 val assetEntity = existingAsset?.copy(
 53	 downloadStatus = AssetDownloadStatus.DOWNLOADING.name,
 54	 updatedAt = System.currentTimeMillis()
 55	 ) ?: com.example.geekdiary.data.local.entity.AssetEntity(
 56	 id = assetId,
 57	 filename = filename,
 58	 diaryEntryId = diaryEntryId,
 59	 downloadStatus = AssetDownloadStatus.DOWNLOADING.name
 60	 )
 61	 
 62	 assetDao.insertAsset(assetEntity)
 63	 
 64	 // Download from backend
 65	 return when (val result = safeApiCall<okhttp3.ResponseBody> { assetApiService.downloadAsset(filename) }) {
 66	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 67	 val responseBody = result.data
 68	 if (responseBody != null) {
 69	 // Save to local storage
 70	 val localFilePath = assetStorageManager.saveAsset(filename, responseBody)
 71	 if (localFilePath != null) {
 72	 // Update asset entity
 73	 val updatedAsset = assetEntity.copy(
 74	 localFilePath = localFilePath,
 75	 isDownloaded = true,
 76	 downloadStatus = AssetDownloadStatus.COMPLETED.name,
 77	 updatedAt = System.currentTimeMillis()
 78	 )
 79	 assetDao.insertAsset(updatedAsset)
 80	 NetworkResult.Success(updatedAsset.toDomain())
 81	 } else {
 82	 // Failed to save locally
 83	 assetDao.updateDownloadStatus(assetId, AssetDownloadStatus.FAILED.name)
 84	 NetworkResult.Error(
 85	 com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.UnknownError(
 86	 Exception("Failed to save asset locally")
 87	 )
 88	 )
 89	 }
 90	 } else {
 91	 // Empty response body
 92	 assetDao.updateDownloadStatus(assetId, AssetDownloadStatus.FAILED.name)
 93	 NetworkResult.Error(
 94	 com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.UnknownError(
 95	 Exception("Empty response body")
 96	 )
 97	 )
 98	 }
 99	 }
 100	 is NetworkResult.Error -> {
 101	 // Update status to failed
 102	 assetDao.updateDownloadStatus(assetId, AssetDownloadStatus.FAILED.name)
 103	 NetworkResult.Error(result.exception)
 104	 }
 105	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> NetworkResult.Loading()
 106	 }
 107	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 108	 return NetworkResult.Error(
 109	 com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.UnknownError(e)
 110	 )
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	 
 114	 override suspend fun uploadAsset(localFilePath: String, diaryEntryId: String): NetworkResult<String> {
 115	 try {
 116	 val file = File(localFilePath)
 117	 if (!file.exists()) {
 118	 return NetworkResult.Error(
 119	 com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.UnknownError(
 120	 Exception("Local file does not exist: $localFilePath")
 121	 )
 122	 )
 123	 }
 124	 
 125	 // Determine media type based on file extension
 126	 val extension = file.extension.lowercase()
 127	 val mediaType = when (extension) {
 128	 "jpg", "jpeg" -> "image/jpeg"
 129	 "png" -> "image/png"
 130	 "gif" -> "image/gif"
 131	 "webp" -> "image/webp"
 132	 "mp4" -> "video/mp4"
 133	 "avi" -> "video/avi"
 134	 "mov" -> "video/quicktime"
 135	 else -> "application/octet-stream"
 136	 }.toMediaTypeOrNull()
 137	 
 138	 val requestBody = file.asRequestBody(mediaType)
 139	 val multipartBody = MultipartBody.Part.createFormData("asset", file.name, requestBody)
 140	 
 141	 return when (val result = safeApiCall<com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.dto.AssetUploadResponseDto> { assetApiService.uploadAsset(multipartBody) }) {
 142	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 143	 val backendFilename = result.data.filename
 144	 NetworkResult.Success(backendFilename)
 145	 }
 146	 is NetworkResult.Error -> NetworkResult.Error(result.exception)
 147	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> NetworkResult.Loading()
 148	 }
 149	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 150	 return NetworkResult.Error(
 151	 com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.UnknownError(e)
 152	 )
 153	 }
 154	 }
 155	 
 156	 override suspend fun isAssetAvailableLocally(filename: String): Boolean {
 157	 val asset = assetDao.getAssetByFilename(filename)
 158	 return asset?.isDownloaded == true && asset.localFilePath != null &&
 159	 assetStorageManager.assetExists(filename)
 160	 }
 161	 
 162	 override suspend fun getLocalFilePath(filename: String): String? {
 163	 val asset = assetDao.getAssetByFilename(filename)
 164	 return if (asset?.isDownloaded == true && asset.localFilePath != null) {
 165	 asset.localFilePath
 166	 } else {
 167	 null
 168	 }
 169	 }
 170	 
 171	 override suspend fun deleteAssetsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId: String) {
 172	 val assets = assetDao.getAssetsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId)
 173	 for (asset in assets) {
 174	 if (asset.localFilePath != null) {
 175	 assetStorageManager.deleteAssetByPath(asset.localFilePath)
 176	 }
 177	 }
 178	 assetDao.deleteAssetsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId)
 179	 }
 180	 
 181	 override suspend fun deleteAsset(filename: String) {
 182	 assetStorageManager.deleteAsset(filename)
 183	 assetDao.deleteAssetByFilename(filename)
 184	 }
 185	 
 186	 override suspend fun getPendingDownloads(): List<Asset> {
 187	 return assetDao.getPendingDownloads().map { it.toDomain() }
 188	 }
 189	 
 190	 override suspend fun getFailedDownloads(): List<Asset> {
 191	 return assetDao.getFailedDownloads().map { it.toDomain() }
 192	 }
 193	 
 194	 override suspend fun retryAssetDownload(assetId: String): NetworkResult<Asset> {

 202	 )
 203	 )
 204	 }
 205	 }

 208	 val totalSize = assetStorageManager.getTotalStorageSize()
 209	 val assetCount = assetStorageManager.getAssetCount()
 210	 return Pair(totalSize, assetCount)
 211	 }
 212	}

 2	
 3	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.TokenManager
 4	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.dao.UserDao
 5	import com.example.geekdiary.data.mapper.toDomain

 12	import com.example.geekdiary.domain.model.AuthData

 15	import com.example.geekdiary.domain.repository.AuthRepository

 21	@Singleton
 22	class AuthRepositoryImpl @Inject constructor(
 23	 private val authApiService: AuthApiService,
 24	 private val userApiService: UserApiService,
 25	 private val userDao: UserDao,
 26	 private val tokenManager: TokenManager
 27	) : AuthRepository {
 28	 
 29	 override suspend fun login(authData: AuthData): NetworkResult<AuthResult> {
 30	 return when (val authResult = safeApiCall { authApiService.authorize(authData.toDto()) }) {
 31	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 32	 val token = authResult.data.token
 33	 tokenManager.saveToken(token)
 34	 tokenManager.saveCredentials(authData.email, authData.password)
 35	 
 36	 // Fetch user profile
 37	 when (val userResult = safeApiCall { userApiService.getUser() }) {
 38	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 39	 val user = userResult.data.toDomain()
 40	 userDao.insertUser(user.toEntity())
 41	 NetworkResult.Success(AuthResult(token, user))
 42	 }
 43	 is NetworkResult.Error -> NetworkResult.Error(userResult.exception)
 44	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> NetworkResult.Loading()
 45	 }
 46	 }
 47	 is NetworkResult.Error -> NetworkResult.Error(authResult.exception)
 48	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> NetworkResult.Loading()
 49	 }
 50	 }
 51	 
 52	 override suspend fun logout() {
 53	 tokenManager.clearAll()
 54	 userDao.deleteAllUsers()
 55	 }
 56	 
 57	 override suspend fun getCurrentUser(): User? {
 58	 return userDao.getCurrentUser()?.toDomain()
 59	 }
 60	 
 61	 override fun getCurrentUserFlow(): Flow<User?> {
 62	 return userDao.getCurrentUserFlow().map { it?.toDomain() }
 63	 }
 64	 
 65	 override suspend fun isLoggedIn(): Boolean {
 66	 return tokenManager.getToken() != null && userDao.getCurrentUser() != null
 67	 }
 68	 
 69	 override suspend fun refreshToken(): NetworkResult<String> {
 70	 val credentials = tokenManager.getCredentials()
 71	 return if (credentials != null) {
 72	 val authData = AuthData(credentials.first, credentials.second)
 73	 when (val result = login(authData)) {
 74	 is NetworkResult.Success -> NetworkResult.Success(result.data.token)
 75	 is NetworkResult.Error -> NetworkResult.Error(result.exception)
 76	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> NetworkResult.Loading()
 77	 }
 78	 } else {
 79	 NetworkResult.Error(com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.Unauthorized)
 80	 }
 81	 }
 82	}

 1	package com.example.geekdiary.data.remote
 2	
 3	import retrofit2.Response
 4	import java.io.IOException
 5	import java.net.SocketTimeoutException
 6	import java.net.UnknownHostException
 7	
 8	suspend fun <T> safeApiCall(apiCall: suspend () -> Response<T>): NetworkResult<T> {
 9	 return try {
 10	 val response = apiCall()
 11	 if (response.isSuccessful) {
 12	 val body = response.body()
 13	 if (body != null) {
 14	 NetworkResult.Success(body)
 15	 } else {
 16	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.ServerError)
 17	 }
 18	 } else {
 19	 val errorMessage = response.errorBody()?.string() ?: "Unknown error"
 20	 when (response.code()) {
 21	 401 -> NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.Unauthorized)
 22	 in 400..499 -> NetworkResult.Error(
 23	 NetworkException.HttpError(response.code(), errorMessage)
 24	 )
 25	 in 500..599 -> NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.ServerError)
 26	 else -> NetworkResult.Error(
 27	 NetworkException.HttpError(response.code(), errorMessage)
 28	 )
 29	 }
 30	 }
 31	 } catch (e: UnknownHostException) {
 32	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.NetworkError)
 33	 } catch (e: SocketTimeoutException) {
 34	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.Timeout)
 35	 } catch (e: IOException) {
 36	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.NetworkError)
 37	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 38	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.UnknownError(e))
 39	 }
 40	}

 1	package com.example.geekdiary.data.sync
 2	
 3	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.SettingsManager
 4	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.dao.PendingAssetDownloadDao
 5	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.dao.PendingAssetUploadDao
 6	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.entity.PendingAssetDownloadEntity
 7	import com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkResult
 8	import com.example.geekdiary.data.util.MarkdownAssetParser
 9	import com.example.geekdiary.domain.model.DiaryEntry
 10	import com.example.geekdiary.domain.repository.AssetRepository
 11	import kotlinx.coroutines.Dispatchers
 12	import kotlinx.coroutines.withContext
 13	import java.util.*
 14	import javax.inject.Inject
 15	import javax.inject.Singleton
 16	
 17	@Singleton
 18	class AssetSyncManager @Inject constructor(
 19	 private val assetRepository: AssetRepository,
 20	 private val pendingAssetDownloadDao: PendingAssetDownloadDao,
 21	 private val pendingAssetUploadDao: PendingAssetUploadDao,
 22	 private val markdownAssetParser: MarkdownAssetParser,
 23	 private val settingsManager: SettingsManager
 24	) {
 25	 
 26	 /**
 27	 * Process diary entry for asset synchronization
 28	 * Extracts assets from markdown content and queues them for download
 29	 * @param diaryEntry The diary entry to process
 30	 */
 31	 suspend fun processDiaryEntryAssets(diaryEntry: DiaryEntry) = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 32	 try {
 33	 val baseUrl = settingsManager.getServerUrl()
 34	 
 35	 // Extract asset filenames from markdown content
 36	 val assetFilenames = markdownAssetParser.extractAssetFilenames(diaryEntry.body)
 37	 
 38	 for (filename in assetFilenames) {
 39	 // Check if asset is already available locally
 40	 if (!assetRepository.isAssetAvailableLocally(filename)) {
 41	 // Check if it's already queued for download
 42	 val existingPendingDownload = pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloadByFilename(filename)
 43	 
 44	 if (existingPendingDownload == null) {
 45	 // Queue for download
 46	 val pendingDownload = PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 47	 id = UUID.randomUUID().toString(),
 48	 filename = filename,
 49	 diaryEntryId = diaryEntry.date.toString(), // Using date as entry ID
 50	 downloadStatus = "PENDING"
 51	 )
 52	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.insertPendingDownload(pendingDownload)
 53	 }
 54	 }
 55	 }
 56	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 57	 // Log error but don't fail the sync
 58	 println("Error processing diary entry assets: ${e.message}")
 59	 }
 60	 }
 61	 
 62	 /**
 63	 * Process multiple diary entries for asset synchronization
 64	 * @param diaryEntries List of diary entries to process
 65	 */
 66	 suspend fun processDiaryEntriesAssets(diaryEntries: List<DiaryEntry>) = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 67	 for (diaryEntry in diaryEntries) {
 68	 processDiaryEntryAssets(diaryEntry)
 69	 }
 70	 }
 71	 
 72	 /**
 73	 * Download pending assets in background
 74	 * @param maxConcurrentDownloads Maximum number of concurrent downloads
 75	 * @return Number of successfully downloaded assets
 76	 */
 77	 suspend fun downloadPendingAssets(maxConcurrentDownloads: Int = 3): Int = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 78	 var successCount = 0
 79	 
 80	 try {
 81	 val pendingDownloads = pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloads()
 82	 .take(maxConcurrentDownloads)
 83	 
 84	 for (pendingDownload in pendingDownloads) {
 85	 // Update status to downloading
 86	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(
 87	 pendingDownload.id, 
 88	 "DOWNLOADING"
 89	 )
 90	 
 91	 // Attempt to download
 92	 when (val result = assetRepository.downloadAsset(
 93	 pendingDownload.filename, 
 94	 pendingDownload.diaryEntryId
 95	 )) {
 96	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 97	 // Mark as completed and remove from pending
 98	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(
 99	 pendingDownload.id, 
 100	 "COMPLETED"
 101	 )
 102	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(pendingDownload)
 103	 successCount++
 104	 }
 105	 is NetworkResult.Error -> {
 106	 // Mark as failed and increment retry count
 107	 val newRetryCount = pendingDownload.retryCount + 1
 108	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadFailure(
 109	 pendingDownload.id,
 110	 "FAILED",
 111	 newRetryCount,
 112	 result.exception.message
 113	 )
 114	 
 115	 // Remove from pending if max retries reached
 116	 if (newRetryCount >= 3) {
 117	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(pendingDownload)
 118	 }
 119	 }
 120	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> {
 121	 // Keep as downloading
 122	 }
 123	 }
 124	 }
 125	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 126	 println("Error downloading pending assets: ${e.message}")
 127	 }
 128	 
 129	 successCount
 130	 }
 131	 
 132	 /**
 133	 * Retry failed asset downloads
 134	 * @return Number of successfully retried downloads
 135	 */
 136	 suspend fun retryFailedDownloads(): Int = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 137	 var successCount = 0
 138	 
 139	 try {
 140	 val failedDownloads = pendingAssetDownloadDao.getFailedDownloadsForRetry()
 141	 
 142	 for (failedDownload in failedDownloads) {
 143	 // Update status to downloading
 144	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(
 145	 failedDownload.id, 
 146	 "DOWNLOADING"
 147	 )
 148	 
 149	 // Attempt to download
 150	 when (val result = assetRepository.downloadAsset(
 151	 failedDownload.filename, 
 152	 failedDownload.diaryEntryId
 153	 )) {
 154	 is NetworkResult.Success -> {
 155	 // Mark as completed and remove from pending
 156	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(
 157	 failedDownload.id, 
 158	 "COMPLETED"
 159	 )
 160	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(failedDownload)
 161	 successCount++
 162	 }
 163	 is NetworkResult.Error -> {
 164	 // Mark as failed and increment retry count
 165	 val newRetryCount = failedDownload.retryCount + 1
 166	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadFailure(
 167	 failedDownload.id,
 168	 "FAILED",
 169	 newRetryCount,
 170	 result.exception.message
 171	 )
 172	 
 173	 // Remove from pending if max retries reached
 174	 if (newRetryCount >= 3) {
 175	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(failedDownload)
 176	 }
 177	 }
 178	 is NetworkResult.Loading -> {
 179	 // Keep as downloading
 180	 }
 181	 }
 182	 }
 183	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 184	 println("Error retrying failed downloads: ${e.message}")
 185	 }
 186	 
 187	 successCount
 188	 }
 189	 
 190	 /**
 191	 * Get pending download statistics
 192	 * @return Triple of (pending count, downloading count, failed count)
 193	 */
 194	 suspend fun getPendingDownloadStats(): Triple<Int, Int, Int> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 195	 try {
 196	 val pendingDownloads = pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloads()
 197	 val pendingCount = pendingDownloads.count { it.downloadStatus == "PENDING" }
 198	 val downloadingCount = pendingDownloads.count { it.downloadStatus == "DOWNLOADING" }
 199	 val failedCount = pendingDownloads.count { it.downloadStatus == "FAILED" }
 200	 
 201	 Triple(pendingCount, downloadingCount, failedCount)
 202	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 203	 Triple(0, 0, 0)
 204	 }
 205	 }
 206	 
 207	 /**
 208	 * Clean up completed downloads from pending table
 209	 */
 210	 suspend fun cleanupCompletedDownloads() = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 211	 try {
 212	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.deleteCompletedDownloads()
 213	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 214	 println("Error cleaning up completed downloads: ${e.message}")
 215	 }
 216	 }
 217	 
 218	 /**
 219	 * Process asset cleanup when diary entry is deleted
 220	 * @param diaryEntryId The ID of the deleted diary entry
 221	 */
 222	 suspend fun cleanupAssetsForDeletedEntry(diaryEntryId: String) = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 223	 try {
 224	 // Delete assets associated with the diary entry
 225	 assetRepository.deleteAssetsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId)
 226	 
 227	 // Remove pending downloads for this entry
 228	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownloadsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId)
 229	 
 230	 // Remove pending uploads for this entry
 231	 pendingAssetUploadDao.deletePendingUploadsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId)
 232	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 233	 println("Error cleaning up assets for deleted entry: ${e.message}")
 234	 }
 235	 }
 236	 
 237	 /**
 238	 * Process asset changes when diary entry is updated
 239	 * @param oldDiaryEntry The old diary entry
 240	 * @param newDiaryEntry The new diary entry
 241	 */
 242	 suspend fun processAssetChangesForUpdatedEntry(
 243	 oldDiaryEntry: DiaryEntry, 
 244	 newDiaryEntry: DiaryEntry
 245	 ) = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 246	 try {
 247	 val oldAssets = markdownAssetParser.extractAssetFilenames(oldDiaryEntry.body).toSet()
 248	 val newAssets = markdownAssetParser.extractAssetFilenames(newDiaryEntry.body).toSet()
 249	 
 250	 // Assets that were removed
 251	 val removedAssets = oldAssets - newAssets
 252	 for (filename in removedAssets) {
 253	 assetRepository.deleteAsset(filename)
 254	 }
 255	 
 256	 // Assets that were added
 257	 val addedAssets = newAssets - oldAssets
 258	 for (filename in addedAssets) {
 259	 if (!assetRepository.isAssetAvailableLocally(filename)) {
 260	 val pendingDownload = PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 261	 id = UUID.randomUUID().toString(),
 262	 filename = filename,
 263	 diaryEntryId = newDiaryEntry.date.toString(),
 264	 downloadStatus = "PENDING"
 265	 )
 266	 pendingAssetDownloadDao.insertPendingDownload(pendingDownload)
 267	 }
 268	 }
 269	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 270	 println("Error processing asset changes for updated entry: ${e.message}")
 271	 }
 272	 }
 273	}

 22	 
 23	 private lateinit var assetSyncManager: AssetSyncManager
 24	 private val assetRepository = mockk<AssetRepository>()
 25	 private val pendingAssetDownloadDao = mockk<PendingAssetDownloadDao>()
 26	 private val pendingAssetUploadDao = mockk<PendingAssetUploadDao>()
 27	 private val markdownAssetParser = mockk<MarkdownAssetParser>()
 28	 private val settingsManager = mockk<SettingsManager>()
 29	 
 30	 @Before
 31	 fun setUp() {
 32	 assetSyncManager = AssetSyncManager(
 33	 assetRepository,
 34	 pendingAssetDownloadDao,
 35	 pendingAssetUploadDao,
 36	 markdownAssetParser,
 37	 settingsManager
 38	 )
 39	 }
 40	 
 41	 @Test
 42	 fun `processDiaryEntryAssets should queue assets for download`() = runTest {
 43	 // Given
 44	 val diaryEntry = DiaryEntry(
 45	 date = LocalDate.now(),
 46	 title = "Test Entry",
 47	 body = "![](test.jpg) and ![](video.mp4)"
 48	 )
 49	 val assetFilenames = listOf("test.jpg", "video.mp4")
 50	 
 51	 coEvery { settingsManager.getServerUrl() } returns "http://localhost:8080"
 52	 coEvery { markdownAssetParser.extractAssetFilenames(diaryEntry.body) } returns assetFilenames
 53	 coEvery { assetRepository.isAssetAvailableLocally("test.jpg") } returns false
 54	 coEvery { assetRepository.isAssetAvailableLocally("video.mp4") } returns true
 55	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloadByFilename("test.jpg") } returns null
 56	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.insertPendingDownload(any()) } just Runs
 57	 
 58	 // When
 59	 assetSyncManager.processDiaryEntryAssets(diaryEntry)
 60	 
 61	 // Then
 62	 coVerify { pendingAssetDownloadDao.insertPendingDownload(any()) }
 63	 coVerify(exactly = 0) { pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloadByFilename("video.mp4") }
 64	 }
 65	 
 66	 @Test
 67	 fun `downloadPendingAssets should download queued assets`() = runTest {
 68	 // Given
 69	 val pendingDownloads = listOf(
 70	 PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 71	 id = "pending-1",
 72	 filename = "test.jpg",
 73	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 74	 downloadStatus = "PENDING"
 75	 )
 76	 )
 77	 val downloadedAsset = Asset(
 78	 id = "asset-1",
 79	 filename = "test.jpg",
 80	 localFilePath = "/path/to/test.jpg",
 81	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 82	 isDownloaded = true,
 83	 downloadStatus = AssetDownloadStatus.COMPLETED
 84	 )
 85	 
 86	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloads() } returns pendingDownloads
 87	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(any(), any()) } just Runs
 88	 coEvery { assetRepository.downloadAsset("test.jpg", "entry-1") } returns NetworkResult.Success(downloadedAsset)
 89	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(any()) } just Runs
 90	 
 91	 // When
 92	 val result = assetSyncManager.downloadPendingAssets(maxConcurrentDownloads = 1)
 93	 
 94	 // Then
 95	 assertEquals(1, result)
 96	 coVerify { assetRepository.downloadAsset("test.jpg", "entry-1") }
 97	 coVerify { pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(any()) }
 98	 }
 99	 
 100	 @Test
 101	 fun `downloadPendingAssets should handle download failures`() = runTest {
 102	 // Given
 103	 val pendingDownloads = listOf(
 104	 PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 105	 id = "pending-1",
 106	 filename = "test.jpg",
 107	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 108	 downloadStatus = "PENDING",
 109	 retryCount = 0
 110	 )
 111	 )
 112	 
 113	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloads() } returns pendingDownloads
 114	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(any(), any()) } just Runs
 115	 coEvery { assetRepository.downloadAsset("test.jpg", "entry-1") } returns NetworkResult.Error(
 116	 com.example.geekdiary.data.remote.NetworkException.UnknownError(Exception("Network error"))
 117	 )
 118	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadFailure(any(), any(), any(), any()) } just Runs
 119	 
 120	 // When
 121	 val result = assetSyncManager.downloadPendingAssets(maxConcurrentDownloads = 1)
 122	 
 123	 // Then
 124	 assertEquals(0, result)
 125	 coVerify { pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadFailure("pending-1", "FAILED", 1, "Network error") }
 126	 }
 127	 
 128	 @Test
 129	 fun `retryFailedDownloads should retry failed downloads`() = runTest {
 130	 // Given
 131	 val failedDownloads = listOf(
 132	 PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 133	 id = "failed-1",
 134	 filename = "test.jpg",
 135	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 136	 downloadStatus = "FAILED",
 137	 retryCount = 1
 138	 )
 139	 )
 140	 val downloadedAsset = Asset(
 141	 id = "asset-1",
 142	 filename = "test.jpg",
 143	 localFilePath = "/path/to/test.jpg",
 144	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 145	 isDownloaded = true,
 146	 downloadStatus = AssetDownloadStatus.COMPLETED
 147	 )
 148	 
 149	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.getFailedDownloadsForRetry() } returns failedDownloads
 150	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.updateDownloadStatus(any(), any()) } just Runs
 151	 coEvery { assetRepository.downloadAsset("test.jpg", "entry-1") } returns NetworkResult.Success(downloadedAsset)
 152	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(any()) } just Runs
 153	 
 154	 // When
 155	 val result = assetSyncManager.retryFailedDownloads()
 156	 
 157	 // Then
 158	 assertEquals(1, result)
 159	 coVerify { assetRepository.downloadAsset("test.jpg", "entry-1") }
 160	 coVerify { pendingAssetDownloadDao.deletePendingDownload(any()) }
 161	 }
 162	 
 163	 @Test
 164	 fun `getPendingDownloadStats should return correct statistics`() = runTest {
 165	 // Given
 166	 val pendingDownloads = listOf(
 167	 PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 168	 id = "pending-1",
 169	 filename = "test1.jpg",
 170	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 171	 downloadStatus = "PENDING"
 172	 ),
 173	 PendingAssetDownloadEntity(

 179	 PendingAssetDownloadEntity(
 180	 id = "failed-1",
 181	 filename = "test3.jpg",
 182	 diaryEntryId = "entry-1",
 183	 downloadStatus = "FAILED"
 184	 )
 185	 )
 186	 
 187	 coEvery { pendingAssetDownloadDao.getPendingDownloads() } returns pendingDownloads
 188	 
 189	 // When

 191	 
 192	 // Then
 193	 assertEquals(1, result.first) // pending count
 194	 assertEquals(1, result.second) // downloading count
 195	 assertEquals(1, result.third) // failed count
 196	 }
 197	 
 198	 @Test
 199	 fun `cleanupAssetsForDeletedEntry should clean up assets and pending operations`() = runTest {

 203	 coEvery { assetRepository.deleteAssetsByDiaryEntryId(diaryEntryId) } just Runs

 1	package com.example.geekdiary.data.remote
 2	
 3	sealed class NetworkResult<T> {
 4	 data class Success<T>(val data: T) : NetworkResult<T>()
 5	 data class Error<T>(val exception: NetworkException) : NetworkResult<T>()
 6	 data class Loading<T>(val isLoading: Boolean = true) : NetworkResult<T>()
 7	}
 8	
 9	sealed class NetworkException(message: String, cause: Throwable? = null) : Exception(message, cause) {
 10	 object NetworkError : NetworkException("Network connection error")
 11	 object ServerError : NetworkException("Server error")
 12	 data class HttpError(val code: Int, val errorMessage: String) : NetworkException("HTTP $code: $errorMessage")
 13	 data class UnknownError(val originalException: Throwable) : NetworkException("Unknown error", originalException)
 14	 object Unauthorized : NetworkException("Unauthorized - please login again")
 15	 object Timeout : NetworkException("Request timeout")
 16	}
 17	
 18	inline fun <T> NetworkResult<T>.onSuccess(action: (T) -> Unit): NetworkResult<T> {
 19	 if (this is NetworkResult.Success) action(data)
 20	 return this
 21	}
 22	
 23	inline fun <T> NetworkResult<T>.onError(action: (NetworkException) -> Unit): NetworkResult<T> {
 24	 if (this is NetworkResult.Error) action(exception)
 25	 return this
 26	}
 27	
 28	inline fun <T> NetworkResult<T>.onLoading(action: (Boolean) -> Unit): NetworkResult<T> {
 29	 if (this is NetworkResult.Loading) action(isLoading)
 30	 return this
 31	}

Path: app/src/main/java/com/example/geekdiary/data/remote/SafeApiCall.kt
 1	package com.example.geekdiary.data.remote
 2	
 3	import retrofit2.Response
 4	import java.io.IOException
 5	import java.net.SocketTimeoutException
 6	import java.net.UnknownHostException
 7	
 8	suspend fun <T> safeApiCall(apiCall: suspend () -> Response<T>): NetworkResult<T> {
 9	 return try {
 10	 val response = apiCall()
 11	 if (response.isSuccessful) {
 12	 val body = response.body()
 13	 if (body != null) {
 14	 NetworkResult.Success(body)
 15	 } else {
 16	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.ServerError)
 17	 }
 18	 } else {
 19	 val errorMessage = response.errorBody()?.string() ?: "Unknown error"
 20	 when (response.code()) {
 21	 401 -> NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.Unauthorized)
 22	 in 400..499 -> NetworkResult.Error(
 23	 NetworkException.HttpError(response.code(), errorMessage)
 24	 )
 25	 in 500..599 -> NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.ServerError)
 26	 else -> NetworkResult.Error(
 27	 NetworkException.HttpError(response.code(), errorMessage)
 28	 )
 29	 }
 30	 }
 31	 } catch (e: UnknownHostException) {
 32	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.NetworkError)
 33	 } catch (e: SocketTimeoutException) {
 34	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.Timeout)
 35	 } catch (e: IOException) {
 36	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.NetworkError)
 37	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 38	 NetworkResult.Error(NetworkException.UnknownError(e))
 39	 }
 40	}

 1	package com.example.geekdiary.data.network
 2	
 3	import android.content.Context
 4	import android.net.ConnectivityManager
 5	import android.net.Network
 6	import android.net.NetworkCapabilities
 7	import android.net.NetworkRequest
 8	import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.channels.awaitClose
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.Flow
 11	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.callbackFlow
 12	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.distinctUntilChanged
 13	import javax.inject.Inject
 14	import javax.inject.Singleton
 15	
 16	enum class NetworkStatus {
 17	 AVAILABLE,
 18	 UNAVAILABLE,
 19	 LOSING,
 20	 LOST
 21	}
 22	
 23	@Singleton
 24	class NetworkMonitor @Inject constructor(
 25	 @ApplicationContext private val context: Context
 26	) {
...
 29	 
 30	 val networkStatus: Flow<NetworkStatus> = callbackFlow {
 31	 val networkCallback = object : ConnectivityManager.NetworkCallback() {
 32	 override fun onAvailable(network: Network) {
 33	 trySend(NetworkStatus.AVAILABLE)
 34	 }
 35	 
 36	 override fun onLosing(network: Network, maxMsToLive: Int) {
 37	 trySend(NetworkStatus.LOSING)
 38	 }
 39	 
 40	 override fun onLost(network: Network) {
 41	 trySend(NetworkStatus.LOST)
 42	 }
 43	 
 44	 override fun onUnavailable() {
 45	 trySend(NetworkStatus.UNAVAILABLE)
 46	 }
 47	 }
 48	 
 49	 val networkRequest = NetworkRequest.Builder()
 50	 .addCapability(NetworkCapabilities.NET_CAPABILITY_INTERNET)
 51	 .addTransportType(NetworkCapabilities.TRANSPORT_WIFI)
 52	 .addTransportType(NetworkCapabilities.TRANSPORT_CELLULAR)
 53	 .build()
 54	 
 55	 connectivityManager.registerNetworkCallback(networkRequest, networkCallback)
 56	 
 57	 // Send initial state
 58	 trySend(getCurrentNetworkStatus())
 59	 
 60	 awaitClose {
 61	 connectivityManager.unregisterNetworkCallback(networkCallback)
 62	 }
 63	 }.distinctUntilChanged()
 64	 
 65	 fun isNetworkAvailable(): Boolean {
 66	 val activeNetwork = connectivityManager.activeNetwork ?: return false
 67	 val networkCapabilities = connectivityManager.getNetworkCapabilities(activeNetwork) ?: return false
 68	 
 69	 return networkCapabilities.hasCapability(NetworkCapabilities.NET_CAPABILITY_INTERNET) &&
 70	 networkCapabilities.hasCapability(NetworkCapabilities.NET_CAPABILITY_VALIDATED)
 71	 }
 72	 
 73	 fun getNetworkType(): NetworkType {
 74	 val activeNetwork = connectivityManager.activeNetwork ?: return NetworkType.NONE
 75	 val networkCapabilities = connectivityManager.getNetworkCapabilities(activeNetwork) ?: return NetworkType.NONE
 76	 
 77	 return when {
 78	 networkCapabilities.hasTransport(NetworkCapabilities.TRANSPORT_WIFI) -> NetworkType.WIFI
 79	 networkCapabilities.hasTransport(NetworkCapabilities.TRANSPORT_CELLULAR) -> NetworkType.CELLULAR
 80	 networkCapabilities.hasTransport(NetworkCapabilities.TRANSPORT_ETHERNET) -> NetworkType.ETHERNET
 81	 else -> NetworkType.OTHER
 82	 }
 83	 }
 84	 
 85	 private fun getCurrentNetworkStatus(): NetworkStatus {
 86	 return if (isNetworkAvailable()) {
 87	 NetworkStatus.AVAILABLE
 88	 } else {
 89	 NetworkStatus.UNAVAILABLE
 90	 }
 91	 }
 92	}
 93	
 94	enum class NetworkType {
 95	 WIFI,
 96	 CELLULAR,
 97	 ETHERNET,
 98	 OTHER,
 99	 NONE
 100	}

 481	
 482	## Error Handling and Recovery
 483	
 484	### 1. Sync Error Types
 485	```typescript
 486	enum SyncErrorType {
 487	 NETWORK_ERROR = 'NETWORK_ERROR',
 488	 AUTHENTICATION_ERROR = 'AUTHENTICATION_ERROR',
 489	 CONFLICT_ERROR = 'CONFLICT_ERROR',
 490	 SERVER_ERROR = 'SERVER_ERROR',
 491	 DATA_CORRUPTION = 'DATA_CORRUPTION'
 492	}
 493	
 494	class SyncErrorHandler {
 495	 handleSyncError(error: SyncError): SyncRecoveryAction {
 496	 switch (error.type) {
 497	 case SyncErrorType.NETWORK_ERROR:
 498	 return { action: 'retry', delay: this.getExponentialBackoff(error.retryCount) };
 499	 
 500	 case SyncErrorType.AUTHENTICATION_ERROR:
 501	 return { action: 'reauthenticate' };
 502	 
 503	 case SyncErrorType.CONFLICT_ERROR:
 504	 return { action: 'resolve_conflict', conflictData: error.conflictData };
 505	 
 506	 case SyncErrorType.SERVER_ERROR:
 507	 return { action: 'retry', delay: 60000 }; // 1 minute
 508	 
 509	 case SyncErrorType.DATA_CORRUPTION:
 510	 return { action: 'full_resync' };
 511	 }
 512	 }
 513	 
 514	 private getExponentialBackoff(retryCount: number): number {
 515	 return Math.min(1000 * Math.pow(2, retryCount), 30000); // Max 30 seconds
 516	 }
 517	}

 515	
 516	## Error Handling & Security Events
 517	
 518	### 1. Authentication Error Handling
 519	```typescript
 520	enum AuthErrorType {
 521	 INVALID_CREDENTIALS = 'INVALID_CREDENTIALS',
 522	 TOKEN_EXPIRED = 'TOKEN_EXPIRED',
 523	 NETWORK_ERROR = 'NETWORK_ERROR',
 524	 BIOMETRIC_FAILED = 'BIOMETRIC_FAILED',
 525	 ACCOUNT_LOCKED = 'ACCOUNT_LOCKED'
 526	}
 527	
 528	class AuthErrorHandler {
 529	 handle(error: AuthError): void {
 530	 switch (error.type) {
 531	 case AuthErrorType.INVALID_CREDENTIALS:
 532	 this.showError('Invalid email or password');
 533	 break;
 534	 case AuthErrorType.TOKEN_EXPIRED:
 535	 this.redirectToLogin('Your session has expired');
 536	 break;
 537	 case AuthErrorType.NETWORK_ERROR:
 538	 this.showRetryOption('Network error. Please try again.');
 539	 break;
 540	 case AuthErrorType.BIOMETRIC_FAILED:
 541	 this.fallbackToPassword();
 542	 break;
 543	 }
 544	 }
 545	}

 511	 
 512	 private isRetryableError(error: any): boolean {
 513	 // Network errors are retryable
 514	 if (error.code === 'NETWORK_ERROR') return true;
 515	 
 516	 // Server errors (5xx) are retryable
 517	 if (error.response?.status >= 500) return true;
 518	 
 519	 // Rate limiting is retryable
 520	 if (error.response?.status === 429) return true;
 521	 
 522	 // Client errors (4xx) are generally not retryable
 523	 if (error.response?.status >= 400 && error.response?.status < 500) {
 524	 return false;
 525	 }
 526	 
 527	 return true;
 528	 }
 529	 
 530	 private calculateDelay(attempt: number): number {
 531	 const delay = this.config.baseDelay * Math.pow(this.config.backoffMultiplier, attempt);
 532	 return Math.min(delay, this.config.maxDelay);
 533	 }
 534	 
 535	 private delay(ms: number): Promise<void> {
 536	 return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
 537	 }
 538	}

 541	### 2. Network Monitoring
 542	```typescript
 543	class NetworkMonitor {
 544	 private listeners: ((isOnline: boolean) => void)[] = [];
 545	 private currentStatus: boolean = true;
 546	 
 547	 constructor() {
 548	 this.setupNetworkListener();
 549	 }
 550	 
 551	 private setupNetworkListener(): void {
 552	 NetInfo.addEventListener(state => {
 553	 const isOnline = state.isConnected && state.isInternetReachable;
 554	 
 555	 if (isOnline !== this.currentStatus) {
 556	 this.currentStatus = isOnline;
 557	 this.notifyListeners(isOnline);
 558	 }
 559	 });
 560	 }
 561	 
 562	 async isOnline(): Promise<boolean> {
 563	 const state = await NetInfo.fetch();
 564	 return state.isConnected && state.isInternetReachable;
 565	 }
 566	 
 567	 getNetworkType(): 'wifi' | 'cellular' | 'none' {
 568	 // Implementation depends on platform
 569	 return 'wifi'; // Simplified
 570	 }

 376	### Mobile Error Handling Strategy
 377	```javascript
 378	const apiErrorHandler = {
 379	 handle401: () => {
 380	 // Clear stored token and redirect to login
 381	 tokenManager.clearToken();
 382	 navigation.navigate('Login');
 383	 },
 384	 
 385	 handle400: (error) => {
 386	 // Show validation errors to user
 387	 showValidationErrors(error.details);
 388	 },
 389	 
 390	 handle500: () => {
 391	 // Show generic error, enable retry
 392	 showErrorWithRetry('Something went wrong. Please try again.');
 393	 },
 394	 
 395	 handleNetworkError: () => {
 396	 // Enable offline mode if applicable
 397	 enableOfflineMode();
 398	 }
 399	};

 605	#### Challenge 2: Network Result Type Safety
 606	**Problem**: Generic type casting issues with `NetworkResult<T>`
 607	**Solution**: Explicit type construction in repository implementations
 608	```kotlin
 609	// Instead of: return result
 610	// Use: return NetworkResult.Error(result.exception)
 611	```
 612	
 613	#### Challenge 3: First-Time Sync UX
 614	**Problem**: Users need immediate feedback on sync status
 615	**Solution**: Prominent sync message with progress indicator
 616	**Key**: Auto-hide message when complete, don't require user action

 47	// Pending Asset Download Entity Mappers
 48	fun PendingAssetDownloadEntity.toDomain(): Asset {
 49	 return Asset(
 50	 id = id,
 51	 filename = filename,
 52	 localFilePath = null,
 53	 diaryEntryId = diaryEntryId,
 54	 isDownloaded = false,
 55	 downloadStatus = when (downloadStatus.uppercase()) {
 56	 "PENDING" -> AssetDownloadStatus.PENDING
 57	 "DOWNLOADING" -> AssetDownloadStatus.DOWNLOADING
 58	 "COMPLETED" -> AssetDownloadStatus.COMPLETED
 59	 "FAILED" -> AssetDownloadStatus.FAILED
 60	 else -> AssetDownloadStatus.PENDING
 61	 },
 62	 createdAt = LocalDateTime.ofInstant(Instant.ofEpochMilli(createdAt), ZoneId.systemDefault()),
 63	 updatedAt = LocalDateTime.ofInstant(Instant.ofEpochMilli(updatedAt), ZoneId.systemDefault())
 64	 )
 65	}

 73	 "PENDING" -> AssetUploadStatus.PENDING
 74	 "UPLOADING" -> AssetUploadStatus.UPLOADING
 75	 "COMPLETED" -> AssetUploadStatus.COMPLETED
 76	 "FAILED" -> AssetUploadStatus.FAILED

## ✅ All Tasks Completed Successfully

### Task 1: Add MockK test dependency and re-run tests
- **Added MockK dependency** to the version catalog (`io.mockk:mockk:1.13.12`) and app module's `testImplementation`
- **Fixed Hilt DI issue** by adding `@Inject` constructor and `@Singleton` annotation to `MarkdownAssetParser`
- **Fixed failing unit tests** by correcting method signatures and mock expectations:
 - Fixed `AuthRepositoryImplTest` UnfinishedStubbingException by using `mockk<okhttp3.ResponseBody>(relaxed = true)`
 - Fixed `AssetRepositoryImplTest` by updating `updateDownloadStatus` verification to match 3-parameter signature
 - Fixed `AssetSyncManagerTest` by correcting all DAO method mock signatures:
 - `updateDownloadStatus(id, status, updatedAt)` - 3 parameters
 - `updateDownloadFailure(id, status, retryCount, errorMessage, updatedAt)` - 5 parameters
- **All 43 unit tests now pass** ✅

### Key Changes Made:
1. **Version Catalog** (`gradle/libs.versions.toml`):
 - Added `mockk = "1.13.12"` version
 - Added `mockk = { group = "io.mockk", name = "mockk", version.ref = "mockk" }` library

2. **App Build File** (`app/build.gradle.kts`):
 - Added `testImplementation(libs.mockk)` dependency

3. **Hilt DI Fix** (`MarkdownAssetParser.kt`):
 - Added `@Inject` constructor and `@Singleton` annotation for proper DI

4. **Test Fixes**:
 - Updated all mock method signatures to match actual DAO interfaces
 - Fixed ResponseBody mocking with proper MockK syntax
 - Corrected test expectations to match implementation behavior

The build is now successful with all unit tests passing, and the MockK dependency is properly integrated for future testing needs.

 Explanation for issues of type "ScopedStorage":
 Scoped storage is enforced on Android 10+ (or Android 11+ if using
 requestLegacyExternalStorage). In particular, WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE will
 no longer provide write access to all files; it will provide the equivalent
 of READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE instead.

 As of Android 13, if you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media
 files on the shared storage, you should be using instead one or more new
 storage permissions:
 * android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGES
 * android.permission.READ_MEDIA_VIDEO
 * android.permission.READ_MEDIA_AUDIO

 and then add maxSdkVersion="33" to the older permission. See the developer
 guide for how to do this:
 https://developer.android.com/about/versions/13/behavior-changes-13#granula
 r-media-permissions

 The MANAGE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission can be used to manage all files, but
 it is rarely necessary and most apps on Google Play are not allowed to use
 it. Most apps should instead migrate to use scoped storage. To modify or
 delete files, apps should request write access from the user as described
 at https://goo.gle/android-mediastore-createwriterequest.

 To learn more, read these resources: Play policy:
 https://goo.gle/policy-storage-help Allowable use cases:
 https://goo.gle/policy-storage-usecases

 versions available for the dependencies used by this project. This is

 Explanation for issues of type "ObsoleteSdkInt":
 This check flags version checks that are not necessary, because the
 minSdkVersion (or surrounding known API level) is already at least as high
 as the version checked for.

 Similarly, it also looks for resources in -vNN folders, such as values-v14
 where the version qualifier is less than or equal to the minSdkVersion,
 where the contents should be merged into the best folder.

 Explanation for issues of type "UnusedResources":
 Unused resources make applications larger and slow down builds.


 The unused resource check can ignore tests. If you want to include
 resources that are only referenced from tests, consider packaging them in a
 test source set instead.

 You can include test sources in the unused resource check by setting the
 system property lint.unused-resources.include-tests =true, and to exclude
 them (usually for performance reasons), use
 lint.unused-resources.exclude-tests =true.
 ,

 Available options:

 **skip-libraries** (default is true):
 Whether the unused resource check should skip reporting unused resources in libraries.

 Many libraries will declare resources that are part of the library surface; other modules depending on the library will also reference the resources. To avoid reporting all these resources as unused (in the context of a library), the unused resource check normally skips reporting unused resources in libraries. Instead, run the unused resource check on the consuming app module (along with `checkDependencies=true`).

 However, there are cases where you want to check that all the resources declared in a library are used; in that case, you can disable the skip option.

 To configure this option, use a `lint.xml` file with an <option> like this:

 ```xml
 <lint>
 <issue id="UnusedResources">
 <option name="skip-libraries" value="true" />
 </issue>
 </lint>
 ```

 Explanation for issues of type "UseKtx":
 The Android KTX libraries decorates the Android platform SDK as well as
 various libraries with more convenient extension functions available from
 Kotlin, allowing you to use default parameters, named parameters, and
 more.

 Available options:

 **remove-defaults** (default is true):
 Whether to skip arguments that match the defaults provided by the extension.

 Extensions often provide default values for some of the parameters. For example:
 ```kotlin
 fun Path.readLines(charset: Charset = Charsets.UTF_8): List<String> { return Files.readAllLines(this, charset) }
 ```
 This lint check will by default automatically omit parameters that match the default, so if your code was calling

 ```kotlin
 Files.readAllLines(file, Charset.UTF_8)
 ```
 lint would replace this with
 ```kotlin
 file.readLines()
 ```
 rather than

 ```kotlin
 file.readLines(Charset.UTF_8
 ```
 You can turn this behavior off using this option.

 To configure this option, use a `lint.xml` file with an <option> like this:

 ```xml
 <lint>
 <issue id="UseKtx">
 <option name="remove-defaults" value="true" />
 </issue>
 </lint>
 ```

 **require-present** (default is true):
 Whether to only offer extensions already available.

 This option lets you only have lint suggest extension replacements if those extensions are already available on the class path (in other words, you're already depending on the library containing the extension method.)

 To configure this option, use a `lint.xml` file with an <option> like this:

 ```xml
 <lint>
 <issue id="UseKtx">
 <option name="require-present" value="true" />
 </issue>
 </lint>
 ```

 Explanation for issues of type "ScopedStorage":
 Scoped storage is enforced on Android 10+ (or Android 11+ if using
 requestLegacyExternalStorage). In particular, WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE will
 no longer provide write access to all files; it will provide the equivalent
 of READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE instead.

 As of Android 13, if you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media
 files on the shared storage, you should be using instead one or more new
 storage permissions:
 * android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGES
 * android.permission.READ_MEDIA_VIDEO
 * android.permission.READ_MEDIA_AUDIO

 and then add maxSdkVersion="33" to the older permission. See the developer
 guide for how to do this:
 https://developer.android.com/about/versions/13/behavior-changes-13#granula
 r-media-permissions

 The MANAGE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission can be used to manage all files, but
 it is rarely necessary and most apps on Google Play are not allowed to use
 it. Most apps should instead migrate to use scoped storage. To modify or
 delete files, apps should request write access from the user as described
 at https://goo.gle/android-mediastore-createwriterequest.

 To learn more, read these resources: Play policy:
 https://goo.gle/policy-storage-help Allowable use cases:
 https://goo.gle/policy-storage-usecases

 Explanation for issues of type "UnusedResources":
 Unused resources make applications larger and slow down builds.


 The unused resource check can ignore tests. If you want to include
 resources that are only referenced from tests, consider packaging them in a
 test source set instead.

 You can include test sources in the unused resource check by setting the
 system property lint.unused-resources.include-tests =true, and to exclude
 them (usually for performance reasons), use
 lint.unused-resources.exclude-tests =true.
 ,

 Available options:

 **skip-libraries** (default is true):
 Whether the unused resource check should skip reporting unused resources in libraries.

 Many libraries will declare resources that are part of the library surface; other modules depending on the library will also reference the resources. To avoid reporting all these resources as unused (in the context of a library), the unused resource check normally skips reporting unused resources in libraries. Instead, run the unused resource check on the consuming app module (along with `checkDependencies=true`).

 However, there are cases where you want to check that all the resources declared in a library are used; in that case, you can disable the skip option.

 To configure this option, use a `lint.xml` file with an <option> like this:

 ```xml
 <lint>
 <issue id="UnusedResources">
 <option name="skip-libraries" value="true" />
 </issue>
 </lint>
 ```

 393	### 1. Client-Side Validation
 394	```typescript
 395	const validateItemsRequest = (data: ItemsRequest): ValidationResult => {
 396	 const errors: string[] = [];
 397	 
 398	 // Date validation
 399	 if (!isValidISODate(data.date)) {
 400	 errors.push('Invalid date format');
 401	 }
 402	 
 403	 // Title validation
 404	 if (!data.title || data.title.trim().length === 0) {
 405	 errors.push('Title is required');
 406	 }
 407	 
 408	 if (data.title.length > 200) {
 409	 errors.push('Title too long (max 200 characters)');
 410	 }
 411	 
 412	 // Body validation
 413	 if (!data.body || data.body.trim().length === 0) {
 414	 errors.push('Entry content is required');
 415	 }
 416	 
 417	 // Tags validation
 418	 if (data.tags) {
 419	 data.tags = data.tags
 420	 .map(tag => tag.trim().toLowerCase())
 421	 .filter(tag => tag.length > 0)
 422	 .filter((tag, index, arr) => arr.indexOf(tag) === index); // Remove duplicates
 423	 }

 61	 )
 62	 } else {

 68	 }

 70	 
 71	 fun detectConflict(localEntry: DiaryEntry, remoteChange: SyncChange): Boolean {
 72	 // A conflict exists if:
 73	 // 1. Both local and remote entries exist for the same date
 74	 // 2. Local entry needs sync (has been modified locally)
 75	 // 3. Remote change is not a deletion
 76	 
 77	 return localEntry.needsSync && 
 78	 remoteChange.itemSnapshot != null &&
 79	 localEntry.date == remoteChange.date
 80	 }

Path: README.md
 1	# GeekDiary Android App
 2	
 3	A modern Android diary application built with Jetpack Compose, following Material Design 3 guidelines.
 4	
 5	## Features
 6	
 7	- **Main Page**: View today's diary entry with date navigation
 8	- **Offline-First**: Local storage with background synchronization
 9	- **Modern UI**: Built with Jetpack Compose and Material Design 3
 10	- **Secure Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with secure token storage
 11	
 12	## Tech Stack
 13	
 14	- **UI**: Jetpack Compose, Material Design 3
 15	- **Architecture**: MVVM with Repository pattern
 16	- **Dependency Injection**: Hilt
 17	- **Database**: Room (SQLite)
 18	- **Networking**: Retrofit + OkHttp
 19	- **JSON**: Moshi
 20	- **Testing**: JUnit, Mockito, Turbine
 21	
 22	## Project Structure
 23	
 24	```
 25	app/src/main/java/com/example/geekdiary/
 26	├── data/
 27	│ ├── local/ # Room database, DAOs, entities
 28	│ ├── remote/ # API services, DTOs
 29	│ └── repository/ # Repository implementations
 30	├── domain/
 31	│ ├── model/ # Domain models
 32	│ ├── repository/ # Repository interfaces
 33	│ └── usecase/ # Business logic use cases
 34	├── presentation/
 35	│ ├── ui/
 36	│ │ ├── main/ # Main screen
 37	│ │ ├── auth/ # Authentication screens
 38	│ │ └── theme/ # App theme
 39	│ └── viewmodel/ # ViewModels
 40	└── di/ # Hilt modules
 41	```
 42	
 43	## Backend API
 44	
 45	The app connects to a local backend running at `http://localhost:8080` with the following endpoints:
 46	
 47	- `POST /v1/authorize` - Authentication
 48	- `GET /v1/user` - User profile
 49	- `GET /v1/items` - Get diary entries
 50	- `PUT /v1/items` - Create/update diary entries
 51	- `GET /v1/sync/changes` - Synchronization
 52	
 53	## Development Setup
 54	
 55	1. Clone the repository
 56	2. Open in Android Studio
 57	3. Ensure backend is running at `http://localhost:8080`
 58	4. Build and run the app
 59	
 60	## Testing
 61	
 62	Run tests with:
 63	```bash
 64	./gradlew test
 65	./gradlew connectedAndroidTest
 66	```
 67	
 68	## Code Style
 69	
 70	- Follow standard Kotlin conventions
 71	- Use meaningful variable and function names
 72	- Add KDoc comments for public APIs
 73	- Keep functions small and focused
 74	- Use dependency injection for testability

Path: app/src/main/java/com/example/geekdiary/MainActivity.kt
 1	package com.example.geekdiary
 2	
 3	import android.content.pm.PackageManager
 4	import android.os.Bundle
 5	import android.widget.Toast
 6	import androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
 7	import androidx.activity.compose.setContent
 8	import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
 9	import androidx.activity.result.contract.ActivityResultContracts
 10	import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxSize
 11	import androidx.compose.material3.MaterialTheme
 12	import androidx.compose.material3.Surface
 13	import androidx.compose.runtime.Composable
 14	import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
 15	import androidx.compose.ui.tooling.preview.Preview
 16	import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint
 17	import com.example.geekdiary.data.local.PermissionManager
 18	import com.example.geekdiary.navigation.DiaryNavigation
 19	import com.example.geekdiary.ui.theme.GeekDiaryTheme
 20	import javax.inject.Inject
 21	
 22	@AndroidEntryPoint
 23	class MainActivity : ComponentActivity() {
 24	
 25	 @Inject
 26	 lateinit var permissionManager: PermissionManager
 27	
 28	 private val storagePermissionLauncher = registerForActivityResult(
 29	 ActivityResultContracts.RequestMultiplePermissions()
 30	 ) { permissions ->
 31	 val allGranted = permissions.values.all { it }
 32	 if (allGranted) {
 33	 Toast.makeText(this, "Storage permissions granted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
 34	 } else {
 35	 Toast.makeText(
 36	 this,
 37	 "Storage permissions are required for asset management",
 38	 Toast.LENGTH_LONG
 39	 ).show()
 40	 }
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 44	 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 45	 enableEdgeToEdge()
 46	
 47	 // Request storage permissions if needed
 48	 requestStoragePermissionsIfNeeded()
 49	
 50	 setContent {
 51	 GeekDiaryTheme {
 52	 Surface(
 53	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize(),
 54	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.background
 55	 ) {
 56	 DiaryApp()
 57	 }
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 private fun requestStoragePermissionsIfNeeded() {
 63	 if (!permissionManager.hasStoragePermissions()) {
 64	 val requiredPermissions = permissionManager.getRequiredStoragePermissions()
 65	 if (requiredPermissions.isNotEmpty()) {
 66	 if (permissionManager.shouldShowStoragePermissionRationale(this)) {
 67	 // Show rationale dialog
 68	 Toast.makeText(
 69	 this,
 70	 "Storage permissions are needed to save and manage diary assets (images and videos)",
 71	 Toast.LENGTH_LONG
 72	 ).show()
 73	 }
 74	 storagePermissionLauncher.launch(requiredPermissions)
 75	 }
 76	 }
 77	 }
 78	}
 79	
 80	@Composable
 81	fun DiaryApp() {
 82	 DiaryNavigation()
 83	}
 84	
 85	@Preview(showBackground = true)
 86	@Composable
 87	fun DiaryAppPreview() {
 88	 GeekDiaryTheme {
 89	 DiaryApp()

 3	import java.util.regex.Pattern

 5	/**
 6	 * Utility class for parsing Markdown content to extract asset references
 7	 * and transform URLs between backend and local formats.
 8	 */
 9	class MarkdownAssetParser {
 10	 
 11	 companion object {
 12	 // Regex pattern to match ![](filename.ext) format
 13	 private val ASSET_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("!\\[([^\\]]*)\\]\\(([^)]+)\\)")
 14	 
 15	 // Common image and video file extensions
 16	 private val SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS = setOf(
 17	 "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "gif", "webp", "bmp", "svg",
 18	 "mp4", "avi", "mov", "wmv", "flv", "webm", "mkv"
 19	 )
 20	 
 21	 private const val BACKEND_ASSET_PATH = "/web/assets/"
 22	 }
 23	 
 24	 /**
 25	 * Extract asset filenames from Markdown content
 26	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content to parse
 27	 * @return List of asset filenames found in the content
 28	 */
 29	 fun extractAssetFilenames(markdownContent: String): List<String> {
 30	 val assetFilenames = mutableListOf<String>()
 31	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 32	 
 33	 while (matcher.find()) {
 34	 val url = matcher.group(2) // The URL part inside parentheses
 35	 val filename = extractFilenameFromUrl(url)
 36	 
 37	 if (filename != null && isSupportedAssetFile(filename)) {
 38	 assetFilenames.add(filename)
 39	 }
 40	 }
 41	 
 42	 return assetFilenames.distinct()
 43	 }

 53	 markdownContent: String, 
 54	 baseUrl: String,
 55	 assetPathMapping: Map<String, String>
 56	 ): String {

 58	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
...

 76	 /**
 77	 * Convert local file paths to backend URLs in Markdown content
 78	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with local file paths
 79	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 80	 * @return Markdown content with backend URLs
 81	 */
 82	 fun convertLocalUrlsToBackend(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 83	 var result = markdownContent
 84	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 85	 
 86	 while (matcher.find()) {
 87	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 88	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 89	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 90	 
 91	 if (url.startsWith("file://")) {
 92	 // Extract filename from local file path
 93	 val localPath = url.removePrefix("file://")
 94	 val filename = localPath.substringAfterLast("/")
 95	 
 96	 if (isSupportedAssetFile(filename)) {
 97	 val backendUrl = "$baseUrl$BACKEND_ASSET_PATH$filename"
 98	 val newMatch = "![$altText]($backendUrl)"
 99	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 100	 }
 101	 }
 102	 }
 103	 
 104	 return result
 105	 }
 106	 
 107	 /**
 108	 * Convert relative asset filenames to full backend URLs
 109	 * @param markdownContent The markdown content with relative filenames
 110	 * @param baseUrl The base URL of the backend server
 111	 * @return Markdown content with full backend URLs
 112	 */
 113	 fun convertRelativeToBackendUrls(markdownContent: String, baseUrl: String): String {
 114	 var result = markdownContent
 115	 val matcher = ASSET_PATTERN.matcher(markdownContent)
 116	 
 117	 while (matcher.find()) {
 118	 val fullMatch = matcher.group(0) // Full ![alt](url) match
 119	 val altText = matcher.group(1) // Alt text
 120	 val url = matcher.group(2) // URL
 121	 
 122	 // Check if it's a relative filename (no protocol, no path separators except filename)
 123	 if (!url.contains("://") && !url.startsWith("/") && isSupportedAssetFile(url)) {
 124	 val backendUrl = "$baseUrl$BACKEND_ASSET_PATH$url"
 125	 val newMatch = "![$altText]($backendUrl)"
 126	 result = result.replace(fullMatch, newMatch)
 127	 }
 128	 }
 129	 
 130	 return result
 131	 }
